title: What are some problems for which technology is not the solution? - Quora

response.answer_text: If something cannot be measured than science can't do anything with it, and as thus no technology can ever get close to it. Unfortunately for us the things that cannot be measured are the things that truly interest us. How do we measure love? How do we measure creativity? Consciousness? How can we apply any science to relationships? What can technology tell us about current affairs? Politics? Zilch.

Compared to all problems range, Technology can solve only a very, very few of them. If you're interested in the theoretical answer to this, check out :- Computational complexity theory - List of unsolved problems in computer science- List of undecidable problems For a more practical answer here are some problems that technology cannot (and will never be able to) solve :- Traveling in the past- Perpetual motion- Predict the future
